main event: A single bright object was observed by persons participating in Sounding Rocket R&D program at Edwards AFB, California, for 15 minutes. Object was seen trailing a jet during the first few minutes.
interesting points: The object was initially observed trailing a jet aircraft.
The object hovered for at least 5-10 minutes at an altitude of about 300 feet, and then accelerated and climbed at a steep angle.
The object was described as a cylindrically shaped object with a domed top, approximately 50-60 feet in length and 20 feet in diameter.
The sighting was made by an experienced T-33 jet pilot conducting a routine navigation training flight.
The incident took place around 1830 hours on 6 June 1957, approximately 10-15 miles southeast of Edwards AFB, California.
sighted object: cylindrically shaped object with a domed top
location: Near Edwards Air Force Base, California
witnesses: T-33 jet pilot, participants in Sounding Rocket R&D program
